Real-Estate Stocks Are Recovering, but Not These Two Groups ... , wrote Stifel analyst John Guinee in a note last week, noting that the average lease term for commercial space is about seven years. Office REITs with quality portfolios—newer buildings in high-growth markets—will weather the shrinking demand better than others, while older office buildings will become much tougher to lease. Guinee wrote that Boston Properties (ticker: BXP), Cousins Properties (CUZ), and Highwoods Properties (HIW) are some of the stocks that have fallen too far. "Given their portfolio quality and/or the long-term fundamentals in their respective sub markets, we expect these names to recover first," he wrote.
